channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole, 17th February
item.description:
New pothole Granville Street, near 34ish

item.title: Damaged pavement by drive to 54 Quat Goose Lane, 17th February
item.description:
Part of the pavement has sunk badly making it awkward and potentially hazardous for pedestrians and car access .
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 56 Quat Goose Lane, Swindon Village

item.title: Pelican lights at junction of Hatherley Road/Alma Road, Cheltenham., 17th February
item.description:
When travelling into town, the nearside traffic light head appears to have failed.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Malvern Road, Cheltenham, 17th February
item.description:
Turning into Malvern Road from Lansdown Crescent, it's 20 - 40 yards in at most.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 19 Lansdown Court Malvern Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Deep pothole; Reddings Road., 17th February
item.description:
Easily located as it's adjacent to the bus shelter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 82 Reddings Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Potholes and excess grit/mud on road, 17th February
item.description:
Potholes and excess grit /mud on kerb/ road Potholes now deep and impossible to avoid even at low speed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Hatherley Lodge Down Hatherley Lane, Down Hatherley

item.title: Deep and long potholes next to Edward Street just off bath road, 17th February
item.description:
There are a long trail of 8-12 potholes at the crossroad just off Bath Road, some of which are 3-4 inches deep and fragmenting. Thank you, Tabi

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Grafton Court Norwood Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road in very poor repair, 17th February
item.description:
Road really needs repairing: falling apart in various places.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Norwood Road, Cheltenham

item.title: Big pothole, 17th February
item.description:
Road in general bad repair but particularly deep pothole here.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Norwood Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: "H" marking obliterated by potholes and road surface breaking up., 17th February
item.description:
The "H" marking has gradually broken away with the worn out road surface. I was advised by a Glos. Highways Inspection Team to use this service to matters rectified. The problem is alongside the rear gated entrance to No. 1 Hawkswood Road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 2 Woodlands Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large branch blocking entire pavement, 17th February
item.description:
Large branch blocking entire pavement (even number side) in Nettleton road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 44 Nettleton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive noise from lorries driving over pothole M5, 17th February
item.description:
Neighbours bordering M5, junction 17A, by the footbridge reporting loud bangs when lorries travelling under the bridge/southbound. ? Pothole or road surface.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping & litter from Barnwood bypass & A417 off bridges onto Churchdown Lane, 17th February
item.description:
Old Mattresses, Builders rubbish, excessive litter on Churchdown Lane, Barnwood bypass
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive noise from lorries when driving under bridge probably due to road surface., 17th February
item.description:
Loud bangs, causing vibrations to houses on churchdown lane. Happens when lorries go under the footbridge on the m5 around junction 11a. Noise is getting worse, could be due to lorries hitting a pot hole.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): M5, Hucclecote
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 60cm wide and 20cm deep pothole, 17th February
item.description:
Pothole in road where unavoidable due to parked cars on the road caused tyre to burst

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 30 Orchard Way, Cheltenham

item.title: Footpath disintegrating, needs resurfacing, 17th February
item.description:
Footpath disintegrating, needs resurfacing. Trip hazard, areas often used by elderly and those cutting through to the shops. Unsightly and hazardous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 28 Wells Close, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large holes developing in road, several places, 17th February
item.description:
Large holes developing in road, several places. Has been recently repaired but more large, hazardous holes appearing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): Caernarvon Road, Up Hatherley

item.title: Blocked drains, 17th February
item.description:
Two blocked drains full of leaves needs emptying.

item.title: Large deep pothole in road opposite 20 Hanover Street, 16th February
item.description:
This pothole is very large 500 mm diameter, and 60mm deep in parts. There is also a fair bit of rubble from broken road surface in the road and under nearby parked cars.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 26 Hanover Street, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large tree branch fallen down., 16th February
item.description:
There is a very large tree branch which has fallen down over the pavement between 46 - 48 Nettleton Road, Benhall, Cheltenham GL51 6. This is a council owned tree.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by Bing Maps): 50 Nettleton Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
